channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-15467] Remove 1.x/2.0 TableDescriptor incompatibility
item.description:
I'm experimenting with Master on "2.0" and RSs on 1.x and the first problem that I get is on createTable where the Master is trying to write the HTD as TableDescriptor instead of TableSchema and the RS is not able to read it.

Since TableDescriptor does nothing for now. I'd say we can remove it.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: should we add an "upgrade" component so we can start explicitly tracking when we need to do work to smooth the process?

should we add an "upgrade" component so we can start explicitly tracking when we need to do work to smooth the process?

Stack had an issue to track this I think. I could not find it though.
We don't need the TableDescriptor class as well, no? It was a class wrapping HTD + TableStatus together. It gets really confusing with HTableDescriptor / TableDescriptor.
TableDescriptor is used around the code base. feel free to post a patch to remove that

What is TableSchema?

The TableDescrriptor stuff came in here:

1 commit 3cc5d19039904361f60c413f10f3cbca27a7ba96
2 Author: stack <stack@apache.org>
3 Date: Mon Sep 15 09:34:10 2014 -0700
4
5 HBASE-7767 Get rid of ZKTable, and table enable/disable state in ZK (Andrey Stepachev)

... as part of the effort at "Keeps table enabled/disabled state in HDFS rather than up in ZooKeeper. Auto-migrates any existing zk state."

Ok to remove for now I'd say. Can come back to this later when figure where to move this stuff (doesn't seem like it will be HDFS)
Stack TableSchema is the protobuf of HTableDescriptor
v1 is just a rebase on HBASE-15605

-1 overall

I bumped into this again during debugging something else, and fixed it while I am in that area. Matteo Bertozzi hope I did not step on your toes.

Attaching a v2 patch which removes the whole of TableDescriptor.
